decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development does not benefit from the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), due to its location within an Article 4 Direction area which requires the submission of a planning application for the change of use from Class E to residential use.&nbsp; As such, the proposal would constitute development for which an application for planning permission is required.</p>

<p>The proposal in the absence of a legal agreement securing an amendment to the Traffic Order and a financial contribution towards parking measures would also have an unacceptable impact on on-street parking conditions and highway safety. As such, the proposal is contrary to Class MA of Schedule 2, Part 2a, Class MA of the GPDO.</p>

<p>The proposed development does not benefit from the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), due to external alterations that would be required to facilitate the proposal that would constitute development for which there is no current planning permission.&nbsp; As such, the proposal would constitute development for which an application for planning permission is required.</p>

<p>The proposal new residential units would incorporate poor access arrangements from the public highway to the detriment of the safe and secure passage for future occupiers, to the detriment of future occupiers. Having regard to The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, Part MA.2(a), the change of use would not provide safe site access, contrary to London Plan 2021 policy T4 and Hackney Local Plan LP1.</p>

<p>The proposed development would result in the provision of substandard and poor form of living conditions for future occupiers in terms lack of daylight, sunlight and lack of internal floorspace, to the detriment of the long term health and well being of future occupiers of the development. Having regard to The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, Part MA.2(f), the change of use would not provide an acceptable standard of residential accommodation, contrary to London Plan (2021) Policy D6, LP2 and LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020).</p>
description: Prior Approval (Class MA) to create 4 x 1-bedroom flats (Class C3) along with the creation of a new ground floor residential entrance off Scawfell Street.
